description.narrative: The project will support 3,200 beneficiaries through improved water supplies and water source management. To this end the project will drill 4 boreholes and mechanize 1 borehole to ensure steady supply of water especially in wards 2,5,6,7,19 and 20 that have traditionally relied on rain fed agriculture. Furthermore, the project will also focus on improvement of pasture and browse production through fodder production as well as clearing of invasive species especially in Gudyanga (Ward 20). Livestock Water troughs will also be done to ensure animals have enough water. The project will also undertake reforestation through the planting of 9,600 trees to combat the adverse environmental degradation due to surface flooding. The project will also foster food source diversification through improved production and income and VS&L will be fostered. Throughout the project WVZ will ensure that the communities are skilled in order to increase the resilience of these communities. Trainings such as Conservation Agriculture, Post-Harvest Management, Health Harvest Manual and GBV will be given to the communities coupled with say Solar Driers for Post-Harvest Management. In order to combat environmental degradation resulting from flooding and also in line with WFP’s Watershed Management approach WVZ will work with the communities to erect structures such as check dams, stone and soil bunds to ensure the micro and macro watershed in these wards is protected.
